title: Quiz 1: Foundations & Legal Framework
topicName: KMTC Mental Health Notes  Comprehensive Notes
description: Assess your understanding of mental health history, legal admission procedures (Cap 248), personality theories, and the Mental Status Examination.

questions.question: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), how is mental health primarily defined?

options.text: The absence of mental disorders or infirmity
A state of emotional well-being enabling comfortable function within society and satisfaction with achievements
The ability to suppress instincts and conform to societal norms
A biological balance of neurotransmitters in the brain

questions.explanation: WHO defines mental health as a state of emotional well-being which enables one to function comfortably within society and to be satisfied with one's own achievements.
questions.hint: Focus on the aspect of emotional well-being and societal functioning.

questions.question: Match the historical figure to their contribution in Psychiatry:
questions.explanation: Reil coined the term; Pinel is famous for the Humanitarian period in France; Dix advocated for reforms in America; Tuke introduced occupational therapy in Britain.
questions.hint: Think about the timeline: Terminology -> French Humanitarian -> British OT -> American Reforms.

questions.question: In the Mental Health Act Cap 248, which specific form number is used for an 'Application for Involuntary Admission' by a relative?

richContent.content:
Hint Context:
MOH 613: Voluntary
MOH 615: Doctor's Recommendation
MOH 638: Police Emergency

questions.explanation: M.O.H. 614 is the specific application form for involuntary admission completed by a husband, wife, or relative.
questions.hint: It comes sequentially after the voluntary form (613).

questions.question: Arrange Sigmund Freud's psychosexual stages of development in chronological order from birth:
questions.explanation: Order: Oral (0-1yr) -> Anal (1-3yrs) -> Phallic (3-6yrs) -> Latent (7-11yrs) -> Genital (12yrs+).
questions.hint: Remember the sequence of biological focus: Mouth -> Elimination -> Genitals -> Social/School -> Mature Sexuality.

questions.question: Which of the following are components of the Mental Status Examination (MSE) based on the mnemonic 'ACTMAD'? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: ACTMAD stands for: Appearance, Cognition, Thoughts, Mood (& Affect), Activities, Disabilities/Drugs.
questions.hint: Recall the acronym ACTMAD provided in the study notes.

questions.question: According to the Mental Health Act, a person admitted as a voluntary patient must have attained the apparent age of ___BLANK___ years.
questions.explanation: Part V of the Mental Health Act states that a voluntary patient is any person who has attained the apparent age of sixteen years.
questions.hint: It is the age of consent for medical treatment in this specific context.

questions.question: In Psychoanalytic theory, which personality structure operates on the 'Reality Principle'?
questions.explanation: The Ego is in contact with reality and is able to delay satisfaction of needs until an appropriate time. The Id operates on the pleasure principle.
questions.hint: It acts as the mediator between basic drives and moral standards.
